alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hanover and west central King William Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Studley, or near Mechanicsville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, very heavy rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mechanicsville, Studley, Manquin, Mangohick, Enfield, Central Garage, Rumford, Turpin, Etna Mills and Epworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
